sloth.description: This is a sin because daily prayer is our essential lifeline of communication with God - deliberately neglecting it demonstrates ingratitude to our Creator, breaks our fundamental relationship with Him, and violates the First Commandment's call to properly worship God

sloth.question: Did I neglect daily prayer, allowing myself to grow disconnected from God?
sloth.description: This is a sin because daily prayer is our essential lifeline of communication with God - deliberately neglecting it demonstrates ingratitude to our Creator, breaks our fundamental relationship with Him, and violates the First Commandment's call to properly worship God

extracted_data_phrases: on a Sunday or Holy Day of Obligation
sloth.question: Did I deprioritize and skip Mass on a Sunday or Holy Day of Obligation, placing my personal preferences above my solemn duty to worship God?
sloth.description: deliberately choosing to skip Mass for non-serious reasons shows disobedience to Church authority, ingratitude for Christ's sacrifice, and places worldly priorities above our highest obligation to worship God.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of serious spiritual unrest

blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: as a curse , blasphemy , or profanity

blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.

extracted_data_phrases: in words that were careless , irreverent , or profane

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, such as my retirement savings, my relationships with loved ones, or my physical health, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted the blessings in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence, thinking that they were solely due to your own hard work and determination?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted God's providence in my blessings, assuming they were solely due to my own hard work and determination?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did you ever harbor doubts about God's existence?
autonomy.description: Deliberately entertaining doubts about God's existence is a sin against faith because it questions the most fundamental truth of our faith and shows a lack of trust in God's clear self-revelation through creation, scripture, and the Church's teachings.
